instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..

threads.title: MBA 2015 - <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> running slow
threads.message:
Hi,
I'm working on a MBA 2015 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>. The Board looks very clean, no signs of liquid damage. 
The MacBook turns on, I was able to install MacOS (even if it took about 4h), but it is running very low. 
I already did clean ME BIOS, replaced trackpad flex and tried another SSD, but without success. 

[ATTACH]60953[/ATTACH] [ATTACH]60954[/ATTACH]
Am I missing something?

Best regards and thank you very much!

threads.title: MBA 2015 - <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> running slow
threads.message:
Does fan spin to max?
Looks like thermal sensor issue.

Test disconnecting webcam.
Also try known good LIO flex/board.

threads.title: MBA 2015 - <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> running slow
threads.message:
No, fan is spinnign normal. 
The macbook is not as slow as i normally know it from thermal sensor issues (lacking cursor for example). It just takes very long for example to open safari, load a page, install any application. 

I already tried a known good LIO flex, but i will try another board and disconnecting webcam.

threads.title: MBA 2015 - <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> running slow
threads.message:
So I just tried a known good LIO board, and a known good display. Also I tried to disconnect the webcam and did another SMC reset, PRAM&NVRAM reset.
Unforunately without any changes.

threads.title: MBA 2015 - <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> running slow
threads.message: I also tried another Trackpad. It runs still slow and CPU is most of the time at 100% with only safari open (not loading anything).

threads.title: MBA 2015 - <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> running slow
threads.message:
Check <CHIP>U5800</CHIP>, its traces and adjacent components.
Also check connections to <TRANSISTOR>Q5860</TRANSISTOR>.
